SEARCH
Package org.domain.algorithms

Class BruteForceAlgorithm

java.lang.Object
org.domain.algorithms.AbstractAlgorithm
org.domain.algorithms.BruteForceAlgorithm
public class BruteForceAlgorithm extends AbstractAlgorithm
BruteForceAlgorithm is an extension of AbstractAlgorithm that arranges a Productlist by evaluating all possible combinations to maximize their total similarity. This approach ensures finding the optimal solution but may be computationally expensive for larger inputs due to its exhaustive nature.
Version:
1.0
Author:
Max Estrade Pey {max.estrade@estudiantat.upc.edu}

      public BruteForceAlgorithm(Map<String,Map<String,Double>> similarityMatrix)
      Constructs a new BruteForceAlgorithm with the specified similarity matrix.
      Parameters:
      similarityMatrix - A map representing the similarity matrix where the key is a product identifier and the value is another map containing similarity scores with other products.

  • Method Details

    • getName

      public String getName()
      Retrieves the name of the algorithm.

      This method returns the name associated with this algorithm, which is typically used to identify or display the algorithm's name in various contexts.

      Specified by:
      getName in class AbstractAlgorithm
      Returns:
      The name of the algorithm (e.g., "Brute Force").

    • orderProductList

      public ArrayList<ArrayList<Product>> orderProductList(ProductList list, int xsize, int ysize, int limit, HashMap<String,Pair<Integer,Integer>> coordinates)
      Arranges a given product list using a brute force approach. The method generates all possible combinations of products, evaluates each combination's total value, and selects the combination with the highest value.
      Specified by:
      orderProductList in class AbstractAlgorithm
      Parameters:
      list - The product list to be arranged.
      xsize - Represents the number of columns of the distribution
      ysize - Represents the number of rows of the distribution
      limit - Serves to limit the depth we want to search for the solution.If limit is less than 0, the code ignores the limit
      coordinates - Contains the coordinates of the products in the distribution.
      Returns:
      A matrix that represent the arranged distribution of the list.
      Throws:
      DistributionException - If the ProductList is empty.
